name: Deepika Kumari
biography: Deepika Kumari is an Indian archer known for her achievements in the recurve discipline. She has competed in three Olympic Games (2012, 2016, and 2020) and has won numerous medals in international competitions, including World Cups and Commonwealth Games. Kumari is recognized for her significant contributions to Indian archery.
childhood: Deepika Kumari was born into a financially disadvantaged family, with her father working as an auto-rickshaw driver and her mother as a nurse. She developed an interest in archery at a young age, initially practicing with homemade bows and arrows. Her journey took a pivotal turn when she joined the Tata Archery Academy in Jamshedpur in 2006, where she gained access to proper training and equipment.
professional_career: Deepika made her international debut in 2006 and quickly rose to prominence, winning her first international gold medal at the Cadet World Archery Championships in 2009. She has won multiple medals at the Commonwealth Games, World Championships, and World Cups, including gold medals in both individual and team events. Deepika was awarded the Arjuna Award in 2012 and the Padma Shri in 2016 for her contributions to sports.
